Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, great location at Inner Harbor. You can walk to shops, aquarium, and restaurants. Complimentary breakfast was ok- hot food was not appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: HaskelUK
Reviews.Content: The entrance lobby is rather grand but our room did not live up to that description. Though the ceilings were high and it felt spacious, the furniture and bathroom needed updating and was scuffed. The design of the room was odd with the basin outside the bathroom. The pool was running winter hours(?) so was not open till 4 pm each day which was disappointing as we chose this hotel partly for this amenity ( with kids in tow). The pool itself was very clean but a touch cold and the towels were tiny! The tiny gym was just adequate. Breakfast was included which was a big plus, and this suited us fine with an adequate choice of cereal, yoghurt, juice, breads and hot drinks. Apparently the coffee was very good. The location of this hotel is it's best feature. It's just two blocks from the harbour where we visited the aquarium which the kids enjoyed. We also took the free bus from very close by up to MT Vernon and the art museums around there which was a big success too. Another thing too, though the bed felt OK we slept really badly. If one person rolls over, it feels like the whole bed is shifting on the other side. It suited us fine for what we wanted but for this price we have stayed in rooms with a far more luxurious feel in downtown Washington for example though admittedly without breakfast thrown in. The staff were friendly and quick to offer assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mickeyfanforever
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. HUGE room. Very clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast. Valet parking was terrific and timely. Great stay. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “got ripped off...”
Reviews.Author: CSGandhi
Reviews.Content: we had explicitly requested a suite with the online booking, however we were told that the room would have two beds and an additional rollaway would be provided. When we got to the room, there just was'nt sufficient place for a rollaway. We just had to move out. We got lucky that the residence inn right next door had rooms available, else we would have been in deep trouble. BTW this hotel was filled to the brim with families with small kids (might be the pool)... so be prepared for that...

Reviews.Title: “Nice within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: OnyxLovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and it was a nice, clean room within walking distance of the Harbor. Priced decently and close to the attractions you can't go wrong! Only downside was a lingering smell of smoke that slightly was in our nonsmoking room. Valet was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay.”
Reviews.Author: PhynFan
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty good. Just a couple of blocks from the Harbour. Our room was on a corner where there was a night club. And on saturday night, the music was pretty loud. We had a king size bed, that was ok. The air conditioner was pretty loud. We had the Romance package that came with a "bottle" of champagne and an assortment of chocolates. Champagne was a 1/4 bottle of Brut. NOT very nice. And was warm when brought to the room And 6 lindor chocolates. Valet was very expensive at $32. And it took about 20 minutes for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great location.”
Reviews.Author: craig3970
Reviews.Content: This Hampton was one of the nicest I've ever satyed at. And reasonably priced as well. The locationw as great since it was 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. Wonderful decor, great service, comfortable room. On the negative side, the valet parking was $25 and it took 15 minutes ot get my car. Also be careful that you walk 2 blocks towards the Inner Harbor and not 2 blocks toward downtown as you will see a very nasty area of strip clubs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast but no bar”
Reviews.Author: bridgetravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent wedding in the city. I didn't want to bother with finding parking so I used the valet for 32 dollars which is about right for the city. The room was clean but a bit dark. The wood headboard could of used a cleaning. After getting dressed I went downstairs with my friend to get a drink a the bar before the shuttle picked us up for the wedding, however there is none. I was a bit surprised for a hotel this size. We walked to Peters around the corner. My booking included a free breakfast bar the next morning which was great and the coffee is dark and very hot, much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Huh? This is a Hampton Inn?”
Reviews.Author: rompar
Reviews.Content: That's what I thought when I walked into the lobby, which looked like it belonged to a much grander Hilton property.The front desk surprised me with an unexpected room upgrade (given that I was staying just one night). Otherwise it's just another Hampton Inn, which I find to be consistently good value (especially with no-fee wifi). The livery cab driver who shuttled me over to the Hilton a few blocks away in a pouring rain in his stretched Town Car for just five bucks was the highlight of my stay. I'd stay again, but wish the management reconsiders their no-dogs policy.

Reviews.Title: “Best location with the reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, convenient to shopping to famous China town, to Bukit Bintang and to the shopping malls. Many restaurants are around the area and the price of the hotel is very reasonable and the best BF overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for a long weekend with our 4 kids... Hotel is located right off the Purple Line Connector Bus and is a mere 5 minute walk to the Inner Harbor area with it's wide array of restaurants/shopping/entertainment/Aquarium... Hotel is very modern and is actually built in what used to be a Leading Bank in Baltimore... We were given a room on the historic top floor and the room was very nice and roomy...Never heard any noise per what other reviews had said, and we stayed on a weekend as well... Breakfast was accommodating and a little tight since it was very busy that weekend... The best thing for my family was the very warm heated indoor swimming pool..we spent a lot of time in the evening there since it was one of the warmest indoor pools of any Hilton property that I've stayed at... Would stay there again when traveling into Baltimore Downtown area...

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: dandy_warhol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a quick visit to Baltimore. The hotel was in a great location, only about 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. The hotel is about a mile walk from the Mt. Vernon neighborhood and a little bit more of a walk to the Federal Hill neighborhood. The hotel was nice, the staff very friendly. We didn't utilize the valets but they seemed like a nice group of guys who didn't mind holding our keys while we checked in. We ended up parking at a self-service place just around the block. The rooms were quite spacious with huge bathrooms. The bed linens were interesting. When we first got into the room I didn't know what was wrong with the bed as it appeared to be all lumpy - apparently this is part of their comfy bed experience. I'm not sure it made for a more comfortable experience but it was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for family but..”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: We had great service and very pleasant staff- with the exception of the pool. The person who was at the pool; (cant say life guard because they were fully dressed and working on a computer) but was irritated because he had a break sign up which was literally at the top of a 6 or 7 ft door- we didnt notice the sign until he came over and pointed to it- and then said come in. Then the pool was COLD--as in not heated. The whole reason we choose this hotel is because my daughter wanted to swim. We put are legs and and left when the two girls lips turned purple. Pool also was in need of repair - peeling floor. The rest of the hotel was A+++.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new”
Reviews.Author: mzell1
Reviews.Content: Great choice for downtown. Close to Inner Harbor shops. Great value. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, i certainly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Lee007_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a week and my stay was very comfortable. my room was very spacious with all the amenities . LUVED IT !! housekeeping though was slack, the bathroom was not cleaned properly when i moved in to the room and i had to call them to get it done the next day ( as it was too late ). The reception staff were friendly. The location is great , just a few blocks from the harbor. Breakfast was nice and cozy , not much variety there but they had coffee and hot choclate round the clock. The hotel lobby isn't very big , neither is the dining area used for breakfast. But I would definately stay here again because of the location and the spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: mamasmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend with friends, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,good service, good value!”
Reviews.Author: LancasterTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hampton Inn recentlly and found the service good and pleasant, the location convenlent to the Inner Harbor (3 blocks) and the price value good also. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: hollisPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 2:30 p.m., check in was at 3:00, room wasn't ready until 3:45. Front desk was apologetic, saying there were large groups checking in earlier and those rooms were taken care of first to avoid large groups hanging out in the lobby. We have stayed at many Hampton Inns all over and have never had to wait for a room. If check in is posted at 3:00, I truly expect the room to be available then. Room was nice. We did not experience noise at night like other reviewers. In fact our room was right near the elevator (which I was nervous about), but I never heard it at all. The only thing I heard was the room fridge humming, but I shifted it a bit and it stopped. Breakfast was good, waffle maker always nice. The breakfast "host" went out of his way to find plain oatmeal packet for my daughter. Very sweet of him to go the extra mile. The valet had our car ready after we had called as directed. Great location for walking to the sites of the Inner Harbor. I would stay here again if I found myself back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sometrip
Reviews.Content: Four nights for business. Wife was able to travel with me. Walking distance to the harbor shops and restaurants. Suite was larger than regular hotel room but not a true suite. Still very nice. Very courteous staff. Good breakfast. Valet parking was more efficient than others experienced. They told me to give them a 15 minute notice. I would call, go to breakfast and see the car drive up within minutes. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Friendly but loud”
Reviews.Author: mike h
Reviews.Content: We checked in around 2 am, as we pulled up there were cops and fire engines everywhere. Parking was $32 but the valet was kind enough to tell me of a garage right around the corner for $18 however it was a little sketchy at 2am to be walking a block. Rooms were clean, breakfast decent(free) staff very friendly. The location is nice just a block from the Inner Harbor the main issue we had was the night club across the street. I guess we didn't realize it since we checked in so late but on Saturday we tried to go to sleep around 11pm since we had a 6am wake up however we couldn't. The noise is horrible and the police activity at 2am is even worse. It made us feel unsafe. If you can deal with that great Hotel, if not stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: kidflemingo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and overall it was a good hotel. I did have a few dislikes.I made my reservation for the historic 7th floor and paid the up charge only to be given a room on the 6th floor. The hotel did refund me the price difference once I brought it to their attention. The second issue was the lack of hot water. It was hit or miss on taking a hot shower. There was also a night club across the street was very noisy util around 2am. I am sure if I had been in a different room I may have not heard it. I would stay here agian but I would make sure I get the room away from the night club.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Expensive Parking, Loud at Night”
Reviews.Author: kroche22
Reviews.Content: The bad first. Be ready to pay $32 for valet parking, not much choice in the city I guess and many of the other hotels I looked at were high also. It was Friday night and the hallway was loud, a couple rooms were back and forth doors slamming etc. The good. We were here for a college visit and stayed just one night. The room was average size with two beds. The bathroom was average also. No smells or anything in the room or bathroom. The bathroom contained the shower sink and toilet, I prefer the sink and mirror outside making it easier for two people to get ready. Shampoo and body wash in containers mounted to the shower wall. Just a pet peeve of mine but I hate the system they use for the TV channels, making you through menus and stuff before actually getting to the channels. Breakfast was just OK but it was free. Coffee was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mjmetzler
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location to the Inner Harbor was perfect, it was a 3 minute walk to the harbor. The rooms are very large and cozy for a family of four. Arriving was Hectic as you pulled up and needed to offload people and suite cases, but if you arrive at other than typical check—in time then I am sure it is less stressful. The hotel staff are very precise they will help you off load then take your vehicle away for a parking fee of $30.00 per night, which isn’t that bad. The staff was great and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joetravelerct
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated near the Inner Harbor, but it is also easily accessible by foot to all the areas of Baltimore you will want to visit (Fell's Pt, Little Italy, Sports Stadiums, Federal Hill, Aquarium, Science Center etc.). The breakfast is a nice bonus with fruit, waffle maker and a few hot offerings each morning. The rooms are spacious with a mini fridge and comforters which are cleaned freshly for each guest. I appreciate their efforts to be more green i.e. soap/shampoo dispensers in the shower, rather than individual wasteful mini size containers. Free wi-fi in the rooms is always a plus! The only issue with the hotel is the noisy club across the street. We spoke to the managers and all of the surrounding hotels have been trying to deal with it. The noise does not interfere with your ability to sleep, but it is a prominent background sound between approx. 11-2. Overall, I would highly recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and found cheaper parking!”
Reviews.Author: Denise U
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and comfortable. Beds, very soft and comfortable. Air conditioning unit a little loud was about the only negative point I could make. The breakfast was good with something for everyone. Not alot of tables if the hotel is crowded. We were there on the weekend and it wasn't too crowded and we were able to find a seat with no problem. It is only 2 short blocks from the Inner Harbor that you could walk in less than 5 minutes. It is also a close walk to Camden Yards, about a 12-15 minute walk. We found parking at a garage 2 blocks up in the opposite direction of the Inner Harbor between South Street and Fayette. We left the car about 2pm on Friday and left it there the whole weekend until we left on Sunday night at 6pm and were suprised to see the cost was only $30 for the whole weekend versus $32 per day at the hotel parking. We walked with suitcases and it really wasn't far at all. We ate at Mothers Grille in Federal Hill and walked it. The food was good. We highly recommend Amicci's in Little Italy. You got to try their specialty appetizer the Pane Rotundo. It was $18.99 but delcious!!! The aquarium was great. Fort McHenry was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AKBK_akbk
Reviews.Content: Located in the inner harbor in an old converted office building. Valet parking was expensive ($30+ per night) but was covenient and safe. Room was clean, spacious and up-to-date. Large bathroom. Breakfast in lobby was the usual Hampton Inn fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kp017
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are attending an event at the convention center or visiting Baltimore and the Inner Harbor. Hotel is very clean and decor is updated. Nice flat screen TV in the room. Staff is very friendly. Valet parking is pricey at $32 per day, but that should be expected in the downtown business district of a big East Coast city. I highly recommend this hotel. Check out Peters Pub around the corner for dinner and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Up to Hampton Standards”
Reviews.Author: bguilbo
Reviews.Content: Great Location, built in the heart of downtown Baltimore in a beautifully restored building. Courteous service and very responsive staff. Had some minor issues with temperature control for the shower, but otherwise very clean and well-maintained rooms. It is a Hampton Inn, so definitely don't expect 4-star amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lisa O
Reviews.Content: We were going to the Inner Harbor as a family vacation and found this hotel to be perfect. The location was perfect, two blocks from the Harbor we parked the car and left it entirely for our trip. The valet parking was $32.00 a day, but not unreasonable given other location. The staff at this hotel could not be nicer, they were helpful, friendly and really made it a pleasure to stay. The hotel was very nice, rooms were clean, bathrooms were clean and the free breakfast was great to get the day started. We would definately stay there or recommend on another trip to the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and historic architecture.”
Reviews.Author: bharrisuga
Reviews.Content: Second time staying in this hotel. Love the building and location. Staff was very helpful. Only knock on the hotel is the limited parking means you have to valet, which is time consuming. I've stayed at the Residence Inn next door and they have the same issue, so I'm not blaming them. Just give yourself 15 minutes padding before you have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: hinau
Reviews.Content: A new hotel in an old building. The rooms and bathroom were very spacious and well equipped. The staff were really excellent - friendly and helpful. Good breakfast and free internet computer available to those of us without laptops!. Most of the surrounding buildings seemed empty, but it was perfectly safe at night and very handy to everything at the harbor and the free bus went past the door.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: sarah0263
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the staff from the Valet parking to the service staff. I was treated with the utmost of respect. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The location is just a block up from the harbor so it is an easy walk to get there. The entrance was just off the street but with the valet service that was fine also.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff you will ever find”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our first choice when we started our Baltimore planning but I am so pleased that it is where we ended up. The location is wonderful. We were able to walk to every attraction or location that we wanted to go to. It is only 3 blocks away from the Inner Harbor and just a short walk to Camden Yards. There were Metro stations only 2 blocks away and bus stops across the street. The hotel itself was clean, updated and comfortable. Our room had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed, since I was traveling with my two teenage sons it was perfect. I have never seen a room with that set up. The room also had a mini fridge, microwave, and small counter. They did offer a free breakfast in the lobby. This would be one of my only issues with our stay. The first day it was not that crowded and we were able to get our food with ease, including waffles and other hot options. The rest of our stay the breakfast area was over crowded and the hot food was always empty, the wait for the waffle maker was about 10 people and even the cold items like cereal or mufins were empty. Then there was not enough seating for all the people. I know this is probably a seasonal thing but it was frustrating. I would suggest that they have extra waffle makers that they could put out during peak times or make sure they have more staff working that area to make sure it is always stocked. The other issue was that the pool had very limited hours 3-9pm. Maryland requires a lifeguard be present and I imagine that is the reason the hours are so limited. The best reason to stay here is the staff. I do a lot of travel for work and family and this hotel has some of the best staff members I have ever come across. We arrived very early after a red eye flight and I knew we would not be able to check in yet but the staff welcomed us, held our bags, let us eat breakfast and made note that we were there so that our room would be ready as soon as possible. We did some site seeing and came back a short time later and they had our room ready. Any time we had any contact with staff members they called us by name and remembered our names later. The bell staff was great as well. Over all this was a great stay and we would definetly stay there again. If you are looking for a great place to stay that is close to all attracations and has the best staff, then look no further...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Grandmalynn
Reviews.Content: Loved the place. We had 2 rooms, both nice, comfy beds. We were greeted, treated well, all questions answered, checkin/out easy. Rooms clean, comfortable, housekeeping great (all areas). Location perfect. We walked to Orioles game, harbor, took the water taxi ($10/day) everywhere, including the Aquarium and Fort McHenry. We parked in a parking garage by ourselves ($54 the whole weekend) instead of the hotel valet ($34/day). Breakfast was varied each morning and had biscuits and sausage gravy, mini omelets, make your own waffles. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, well priced, good service”
Reviews.Author: Nessnpete
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel. front desk and valet staff could not be faulted. In the right location in baltimore as well. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff with a great sense of fun!”
Reviews.Author: serendestiny
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful here. We were always greeted with a smile and found the staff having fun with each other and the guests. We were placed in an oversized handicap room that felt damp and didn't feel very clean. The walls were pretty thin in that we could hear activity in the adjoining room and out in the hall. For this reason only, we would look for another hotel. The pool facility was nice. The workout room though small offered lots of options. The breakfast buffet was plentiful! We were within walking distance of the harbor and baseball stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: baneeny
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay here. The location is great, walked everywhere...inner harbor, Camden Yards. Rooms are great except that bathroom sink area very small. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GUINNESS835
Reviews.Content: My wife, 15 year old and I stayed here for 5 nights for the NCAA LAcrosse Championships. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel was extremely clean and quiet. The free breakfast is fairly extensive and was very good each morning of our stay. The location is very convenient, being only a few blocks from the inner harbor. The area immediately around the hotel is fairly safe and we never felt uneasy walking at night. Overall I would recommend this hotel for it's cleanliness, friendliness and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cindarz
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews before we booked our room.We made a great choice. The staff was very helpful,the room was very large and clean.Our room faced Redwood St. but we had no traffic sounds.The breakfast was like any other free offer,choices were many,for a fast free meal it fit the bill.Location is within walking distance of Harbor Place (3 Blocks).I check the room before we bring in our luggage for bedbugs,NONE here.We will keep this hotel on the top of our list for a return visit.Good part of town no fear walking at night.If your looking for a hassel free stay,I recommend the Hampton Inn on Redwood St. You can't find better and the price( AARP rate) was well under other hotels in the area.Staff is top notch. Hotel lobby is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Well Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: TheSoleDoc
Reviews.Content: Traveled from N.Y. and was glad to see a free shuttle would conveniently drop me right near the hotel. The smile and warm welcome I received at checkin was quite refreshing. More important was the ability of the front desk staff to provide knowledgeable information regarding local shopping, affordable restaurants (list provided), and access to transportation. The engineer who came to my room to assist with the temperature control was quite professional and apologetic for any inconvenience. My daughter & I were a little disappointed when we went down to the lovely pool only to find it closed at 8:15 p.m. on a Saturday evening. The complimentary breakfast was much appreciated not to mention delicious. Checking out was as smooth as checking in especially when the valet attendants went out of their way to secure a taxi for us and sincerely sent us on our way expressing "safe travels." Glad I found this great well kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely exceeded ALL expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jkc12727
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 2 teams of 16 and 18 year old volleyball players and parents from California. We were required to use the tournament housing company, unfortunately the housing company was not near as wonderful as the Hampton Inn Managers and staff. The rooms were incredible, but more importantly for us was the attentiveness of the staff in arranging rooms, accommodating special requests, assisting with arrivals and departures, storing luggage, etc.....I don't know if it is the accommodations or the staff that made the experience we will never ever forget! They even helped us arrange transportation to the airport for planes we were about to miss thanks to the tournament. Thank you Jodie and Peter as well as the rest of your staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,quiet,comfortable,reasonably priced but a bit odd (an old building redone as a Hampton)”
Reviews.Author: emetplay
Reviews.Content: Great staff, good breakfast, large room, very convenient location--only steps from inner habor attractions. No complaints from me!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: LWirth
Reviews.Content: We came to the Hampton Inn upon the recommendation of friends and were so pleased with everything! The location was perfect and within walking distance of everything. The free breakfasts were much more than we expected and a real treat! The entire staff was friendly and helpful with whatever we needed from housekeeping amenities, to directions, to restaurant recommendations. By the end of our stay, which was just a long weekend, we felt that we knew Taneesha, Paige and Peter from the reception area. They greeted us when we walked in, asked about our day and made us feel at home. Even the guys running to get our car for us were pleasant and extremely helpful. You don't need to stay in one of the large hotels, we had a great suite, with comfy beds and felt welcome evertyime we walked through the front door!. L Wirth, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Hm...”
Reviews.Author: columbus_11
Reviews.Content: After having read quite a few good reviews on tripadvisor about this property, I decided to give it a try for a weekend gettaway with my girlfriend. The service was mediocre, the staff at the Front Desk did not really seem to care about us and special needs (forgot my washing bag at home so I needed razor, toothbrush, shampoo, etc). The hotel is in a great location- which is why I might return. Service-vise...I might consider going to a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average - good location, mediocre value”
Reviews.Author: lkrg
Reviews.Content: We just completed a trip where we stayed at Hamptons along our trip from Pittsburgh to Phillie to Balltimore. Compared to the others, we were disappointed. The location is very good near the Inner Harbor. Other than that, the value is mediocre. The bed was like a hammock and needs replacement. The room was clean and the mini-fridge was useful. One of our family members wanted an extra blanket and we phoned the front desk around 8:00pm. They said they would get back to us and no one responded at all. The parking charge of $32 is outrageous. Be sure to ask for your car at least 20-25 minutes before you need it, because it takes time for them to bring it to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: I continue to be impressed with Hamton Inns. While it's not the best hotel in town, it's a very good value. It's cost focused but they do a very good job of delivering the best value for the price you pay. The lobby is nice. Much of the hotel is no frills, but it's clean, spacious, quiet, and comfortable. I would highly recommend it for those traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Grea Staff”
Reviews.Author: ladylitauk
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at the Inner Harbor Baltimore is a very nice place to stay. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The staff very friendly and helpful. This hotel is at a great location, just a short walk to the great restaurants and shops in the harbor. We found the hotel very welcoming. The valet service fast and friendly. All the staff were very helpful and courteous, in particular the manager,Jodie, who could not do enough to make our stay as pleasant as possible. We would totally reccommend this hotel for your Baltimore stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get my 100% satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: maggiesmom1234
Reviews.Content: We stay at Hamptons 80% of the time and are never disappointed. Unfortunately, this one, which has typically decent reviews on this website, was not what former visitors had described. Perhaps we got the worst room in the place. Upon arrival, the vivacious valet parking staff were so efficient that I left several items in the car as the swooped us into the lobby. Certainly a good quality, but it was too bad that they had to retrieve the car from where it was parked 6 blocks away just for me to get my hat and gloves (cold blustery night). The whole hotel has very tired decor, especially our room. It just did not feel clean in any way. The carpet was worn and stained; the bathroom was older and dreary and there was a serious ring around the tub. I do not like their new "green" concept of no toiletries except the refillable pump ones in the shower. I am certain that they are just "topped off" so some of the soap and shampoo in them must be quite old. The three of us stuck with the tiny "communion wafer" sized lone bar of soap at the sink which was gone by morning. We could have asked for another, but were not enthused to wait for another bar at 12 midnight. Thankfully the half box of tissues and one roll of toilet paper were enough. The towels were thin and old (like my old ones that we now use to bathe our dog). After I showered I realized that mine was so yellow (but was supposed to be white). Not a surprise though. I didn't notice it sooner because the lighting everwhere in the room was very DIM. There is no way anyone in that room could have read anything. We tried to watch the up to date TV, but there were only a few channels available. At 4 am when I could not sleep due to the perfectly alternating rumbling of the heater with the beep-beep alarm clock noise of the mini fridge placed next to the head of my bed , I considered asking for the Hampton 100% guarantee refund. Instead, I turned off the fridge completely which helped somewhat. I had actually thought it was my husbnd's alarm clock going off every time the fridge kicked in. Thankfully, I was wide awake when we had to get up at 6am. The breakfast was typically Hampton, which although basic, I always appreciate because it is so vey convenient for us when we travel and hate to waste time. Also, the pool was old and brown at the bottom. I am not a "high maintenance" person and I have never written a bad review of any hotel, but frankly, I was pretty surprised to be so disappointed with Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms, breakfast, personnel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer096
Reviews.Content: Large, clean, comfortable room, friendly, helpful and competent employees, about two blocks from harbor area, excellent huge breakfast included. Older hotel in pristine shape. Safe area for walking to and from harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service ever”
Reviews.Author: widetravelsBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the security was great. The hotel staff seemed to have made mistake after mistake. Before my arrival I called and confirmed my reservation and had it pre charged, typical for my stays in Hampton inns. Upon arrival I found out my credit card was not charged to my room and yet my credit card company had it as charged. Whoever I talked to charged everything wrong and I could not pay for my room. I had to have my father fax over a credit card form. They made us wait an hour in the lobby with all of our stuff. After it finally got there the front desk staff forgot to swipe my key cards. We ended up having to come all the way back down to get them fixed. If that wasn’t bad enough hotel staff harassed one of my friends staying with us more than once. We had stayed for eleven days and the staff had seen him with us but any time he went to get coffee he had to show his id and his key card. I guess they have good security. Anyways we then went to the pool that was supposed to be heated but was not heated one day of our stay. It was so cold that we ended up only spending about ten minutes in the pool before everyone in our group got cold. The pool towels were always wet and not fun to use. I complained many times and even wrote a review letter back to the hotel with no response. I would never recommend this hotel for its service but the location was so perfect I would stay again and just give up on the small pleasures.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the touristy heart of Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: TinaK713
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel in a great location! The 'Downtown Deli' right across the street is delicious and the owners are awesome! The staff is super friendly and easy on the eyes and the lobby is warm and inviting granted I was there for the holidays so the Christmas decorations were gorgeous. The rooms are clean and comfy and if you have the money the Mahogany suite on the top level is amazing!! the price is right and the location is ideal for business or touristy plans.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money!”
Reviews.Author: oz_on_the_prairie
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Sheraton Inner Harbor before a cruise and were extremely underwhelmed. We booked this hotel for when we returned thinking that it couldn't be any worse than the Sheraton. We were extremely surprised - it was twice as nice for half the price! From the moment we arrived to doormen that actually assisted with our luggage, to the front desk staff who were extremely pleasant and helpful. We arrived at around 11am and to our delight they had a room ready for us! I think it was Tenesha on the front desk - she was amazing! Our room was on the 7th floor and although it didn't have a view - it overlooked the alley at the back of the hotel - it was large and spacious. It had complimentary internet (that cost extra at the Sheraton) and a refrigerator and microwave, tea and coffee making facilities and best of all - a huge spa bath in the bathroom! It was beautiful. As other posters have mentioned, it is a unique hotel in that it is in an old bank building - it has really interesting architectural features and lots of marble. It was a real treat to stay here and if we ever return to Baltimore this hotel would be at the top of our list! Just sorry we didn't try this one first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location and service 100%”
Reviews.Author: nemakili
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, just a few blocks from the inner harbor. The staff were very nice and helpful, the breakfast (included) was very good, the hotel is beautiful extremely well kept, rooms are spacious and beautiful decorated, the area is very secure and there are plenty of places to eat within walking distances. Parking was hassle free as long as you are aware of the fee, which we did not mind as long as we know that it was safely parked.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding guest service”
Reviews.Author: mmorthimer
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this property for one night, and everything was superb. The staff was friendly, and everyone greeted us throughout the hotel. Kelly at the front desk was extremely friendly and professional, and made sure we were taken care of. Check-in was quick, our room was clean, and the public areas were well maintained and tastefully decorated for the holidays. I would definitely recommend and return to this hotel. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place With Greater Service”
Reviews.Author: NeedAVacation3
Reviews.Content: We travelled for business at the Baltimore Convetion Center. I booked Hampton Inn Camden Yards location. The entire staff couldn't have treated us better. We arrived early and had no problem checking into a room and had a nice breakast in the lobby area. Such a nice touch having coffee & breakfast in the morning at your leisure. After working all day, and the COLD walk back to the hotel it was especially nice to have hot coffee in the lobby as well as some fresh baked cookies (1 night). Thank you everybody for making our stay better than we could have asked for. Don't forget Pickles pub next door - nice neighborhood type pub with great bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “fine service”
Reviews.Author: geci1960
Reviews.Content: An all around a pleasant stay from check in to check out. Kelly at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty. The valet parking went smoothly in and out also. As a frequent traveler to Baltimore I would for sure stay at this property again. Very quite hotel given it's city location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tapdanzer
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled for a mid-week getaway and enjoyed everything about this hotel and Inner Harbor. The hotel was extremely clean, the breakfast was delicious and the location was two blocks from Inner Harbor...absolutely perfect! The staff was helpful and housekeeping was wonderful. Our room was a little small, but that is to be expected in any downtown hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra7457
Reviews.Content: We live in DC and went to meet friends for dinner - Baltimore is an hour from DC. We wanted to enjoy ourselves at dinner and wanted to be responsible, hence the room. We didn't see the pool or the fitness room, but I was told about them. We went only for the convenience, nothing else. The hotel was about a mile from our dinner destination in Little Italy. However, it really is very close to many Baltimore attractions. The room was spacious and clean. The breakfast was perfectly satisfactory - with both a continental breakfast and one can make one'sown eggs and waffles. (The coffee wasn't superior, but that might have been a bad pot.) The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stwar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel because of the proximity to the harbor and not too far from Hopkins Hospital. To say I was impressed was an understatement. We paid $99 for the room for a hotel that was 3 blocks from the harbor! The room was very neat and clean and the staff was EXTREMELY friendly. The always greeted you when you entered and were helpful. We got the double bed room which was larger than I anticipated for the price. We stayed at other hotels in Baltimore and none of them compared, especially for the price! (including the Brookshire a block a way which we HATED). The hotel was close to the circular bus that is free and will take you to the main locations in the city. Plus close to the harbor! And to top it off....FREE INTERNET!!!! The one comment I would make is that the pool is not much of a pool. If you have kids, do not expect to kill time in the tiny little thing they call a pool. This was NOT an issue for us.....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: shr100
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were delighted with our stay at Hampton Inn & Suites Baltimore Inner Harbor. It is situated in close proximity to the restaurants, and attractions of Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The room was very clean and comfortable. Safety and cleanliness / comfort are most important to us and we very pleased with our first stay at this hotel. The included breakfast had great variety and it was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to Inner Harbor then it looks”
Reviews.Author: karen53a
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend asked to go to the aquarium for his birthday so I started looking for a hotel that was close to the harbor but reasonably priced. I am so glad we picked this one. I booked a king size room but when we checked in I asked if we could get upgraded since it was my boyfriends birthday and they gave us a king suite. As previous reviews stated, don't book this hotel for the view, because there isn't any, but it is only 2 blocks from the inner harbor. The room was clean with the most comfortable pillows I had ever slept on. The room darkening draperies were great and the room was pretty quiet despite being on a busy street. The staff couldn't have been nicer- good with directions and just friendly in general. My boyfriend loved the coffee station in the lobby. The free breakfast was great -and fresh. Although I only paid for the one day of parking, the valets were nice enough to hold my car until 5pm the next day so we could go sightseeing. They also watched out bags as we checked out before we went sightseeing. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dld10
Reviews.Content: Central location, convenient to all transportation. Park the car and no need to move it until you leave. Comfortable room and nice historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: jayemli
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel.......the room was comfortable and the bed was the best.....Kelly at the front desk was so helpful and friendly......breakfast should be upgraded though.....eggs were dry and fruit , not so fresh.....but all in all would stay here again......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or personal travel”
Reviews.Author: vacaycay
Reviews.Content: The large hotel lobby is well maintained and brightly lit. Though the building is on the old side, it is evident that maintenance and upkeep are being done. While we were there, we noted painting being done on the lobby ceiling. Wireless high speed Internet was accessible all throughout the hotel, and wired access was available in the room. The room itself was large by my standards, and the washroom was also very roomy. The King sized bed was great, and room service was fine. The included breakfast during my stay consisted of: (make your own) waffles, muffins, cereal, cut fruits, peach yogurt, various juice / coffee, bagels, scrambled eggs (or cheese omelette, depending on the day), sausages (or some other pork dish, depending on day), bagel topper (half a bagel with corn, sausage and some other stuff baked on top - really good. There's also a fruit basket that usually contains some apples and bananas. The location of the hotel is excellent if you are going to the inner harbour area. It's just a few short blocks down to the water and an easy walk. The area around the hotel is decent, and there are a few other hotel buildings nearby. At the time of writing, there is a new hotel building next door that is about to open for business. The only slight negative I can think of mentioning is that the swimming pool is on the small side and doesn't look very inviting. My co-worker decided not to swim in it because it looked a little grimy. Other than that, everything else about the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get what I paid for, the worst experience in a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: travelitetoo
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Baltimore and an overnight stay at the Hampton Inn for a conference. The hotel room had been prepaid as a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. When I got to the room, I noticed that I had been given a handicapped room that reeked of cigarette smoke. I notified the hotel clerk who stated that it was a non-smoking room but gave me the key to another room. That room also reeked of cigarette smoke. The clerk told me that they were all out of rooms and I would have to pick from those two rooms. She stated that all the adjacent hotels were completely booked as well. Since my conference was at this hotel, I decided to stay the night but did not get a good night's rest. The smell got worse when I turned on the air conditioner. The next morning all my clothes stunk of cigarette smoke. The blow dryer wasn't working and they couldn't find me another one to use before my conference started, despite the 30 minute notice I gave them. When I got out of my room, I noticed that it didn't have the "no smoking" sign by the door that was on several other doors that I passed. I am very disappointed that I was lied to, not given what I paid for, and was not offered assistance to arrange for more suitable accomodations given that it was late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: maremarz
Reviews.Content: We stayed this weekend Oct 22-24 - we had a group of 15 cousins from NJ, PA, IL & CA. It was our 4th annual weekend but first one in Baltimore. This hotel was excellent in every way. Rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable, breakfast was great. Centrally located within walking distance of the major attractions. Peter Yeung made us sausage and French toast sticks when they were not on the buffet! I late found out he was the hotel manager! Everyone was efficient and friendly. The only bad thing was the crumbly scrambled eggs - chese omelettes were yummy - this hotel was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Always terrific!”
Reviews.Author: 54171Roadwarrior1
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel twice per year while calling-on Baltimore area accounts of mine. The hotel staff is always friendly, the rooms are spacious, unique and clean while the lobby is beautiful. Location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Ask for More!”
Reviews.Author: brtngrl13
Reviews.Content: All of the positive reviews of this place are pretty much spot on what we received when we stayed at the Hampton Inn - Inner Harbor. For me who had never been to Baltimore, I chose this place based on the location and price and hoped for the best. The Hampton Inn did not disappoint. After an exhausting eight hour drive, we were greeted by the friendliest hotel manager that I had ever had the pleasure to meet. He allowed us to check in earlier, handed out maps and pointed out spots of interest, fantastic for someone that had never been to the city before. Our check-in was quick and trouble free and the manager insisted that if there was anything that we needed, we shouldn't hesitate to get in touch with him directly. Major points for that. Our room was on the sixth floor, and only a short walk from the elevator. The room itself was a good size, more than ample space for the king sized bed a nice seating area next to the windows and a desk. The bathroom was massive. The cleanliness is the upmost importance to me when staying at a home away from home and this place did not disappoint. The place was spotless. Linens were clean and crisp, plenty of towels and complimentary soaps and lotions. The flat panel tv was great and the free HBO was a treat as it was the season finale of True Blood! There was also free Wifi available, great for checking email or tooling around online. The room was quiet, and the bed was soft and comfortable. If you're going for the view, this might not be the place as our room overlooked the building across the street that may or may not have been slated for demolition. This view was easily rectified by closing the blinds. The proximity of this hotel to all the activities, dining and entertainment of the Inner Harbor are what puts the Hampton Inn head and shoulders above the rest. With a quick five minute walk you were in the heart of it all. We chose to take the MARC train to DC one of the days of our stay and we were only a ten minute walk from the Camden Yards Station, meaning our car could stay parked in the lot. The parking is a big hefty at $29/day but its the price you pay to stay in any area that doesn't allow the luxury of its own on-site lot. The free breakfast each morning was a great selection of bread products, make your own waffles, bacon, sausage, eggs or omelets, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee. A great addition for those traveling on a budget. Overall, we had a fantastic stay and I would definitely be back again. This hotel hit all of the bars that I set : cleanliness, friendliness of staff, location and value. I could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: “THE STAFF WAS AMAZING... BEST OF ANY HAMPTON I'VE EVER STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: likeavacation
Reviews.Content: Our first family vacation to Baltimore. This Hotel is located 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. Walking distance to the National Aquarium, Science Center, Childrens Museum, Inner Harbor shopping and dinning, and Camden Yards. The staff at this hotel was amazing. We were greated everytime we walked into the lobby. The staff sets this property apart from any other hotel... ANYWHERE. We will be visiting this area again, and staying at the Hampton Inn & Suites Baltimore Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “We were mislead by others reviews- not the greatest place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cpb617
Reviews.Content: We planned a weekend to visit inner harbor and sight see and we chose this hotel solely based on all of the great reviews we read about it. There were positives to this hotel but mostly negatives. Positives- Clean, decent rooms that were well equipped, extremely nice staff, got to check in early and parking was only 29 dollars for basically a day an a half of valet, very close to inner harbor. Negatives- I had a very bad cold the day of our arrival so at night I was very much looking forward to getting a good nights rest because we wanted to see more at the harbor the following day. The air conditioning unit and the mini fridge in our room was SO loud that i was up wide awake the entire night. It sounded like it was going to fall out of the wall. On top of that we were near some night clubs and a very busy area of Baltimore so the cops and ambulance sirens went off multiple times throughout the night also keeping me awake. While the hotel was a VERY short maybe 2 walk block to the harbor it was not worth it. We ended up leaving very early in the morning and not doing anymore sightseeing because I was sleepless and had to go home and rest. ALSO more importantly they claim to give you a hot free breakfast the next morning. By "HOT" breakfast, they should have said, stale gross western tiny omeletttes with awful potatoes. Everything else was bagels, yogurt, and make your own waffles. The coffee was even horrible. So dissapointing! Would not recommend staying here even for a short visit

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but still disappointing for such a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJKleine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with our 20mth old daughter. The location was good, just a few mins walk from Inner Harbour and shopping, restaurants, Aquarium etc. The interior of the hotel and our room looked impressive and stylish, yet one evening, despite us having to ask a number of times, our room was not cleaned until after 5:30pm. Otherwise, the reception staff were generally helpful. The valets outside the hotel will park your car in a car garage around the block for a daily charge several dollars more expensive than parking it yourself in one of the several garages also located within a block or 2 of the hotel. We found checking in difficult because of this, as there was nowhere immediately outside of the hotel where we could park eaily to unpack the car and get to our room. Breakfast was included in the room price and breakfast tables are arranged around the far side of the hotel lobby, so there is no "breakfast room" as such. The food was simple but tasty (cereals, make-your-own waffles, breads, muffins, hot drinks, juices) and enough to start the day off. Our room was modern, had 2 big beds, built-in wardrobe, bar fridge, large bathroom, TV and airconditioning. The room was adequate, but not especially large. In the block behind the hotel was a bar that hosted music bands playing outdoors. We had a lot of trouble sleeping one night as it was very loud, even above the airconditioning. One very big complaint was about the cleanliness of the indoor pool. There was clearly a coating of green mould around the lights, which when brought to the attention of reception staff, was unfortunately not taken care of (at least within the 3 days we stayed there), therefore deterring any potential swimmers. Overall the quality of this hotel, and certainly for the price we paid, was not to the standard I would have expected.

Reviews.Title: “I have never worked with a more efficient, or a more pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaNashville_TN
Reviews.Content: In July 2010, I conducted a corporate meeting at this hotel. It consisted of sleeping rooms for 56 people and meeting facilities to accommodate this number over a three-day period. The General Manager, Peter Yeung, and his entire staff worked with us throughout our meeting to ensure everything was addressed and handled perfectly. I was impressed by the level of attention paid to the smallest details. I would encourage any group/company looking to host a meeting in Baltimore to visit this hotel and see if their facilities can accommodate your needs. I assure you, you'll not find a more efficient, and more pleasant staff anywhere. Also, for those who are looking to vacation/travel into the Baltimore market, I would encourage you to seek out this hotel. It's absolutely beautiful, and is in the heart of the inner-city. Great location...great hotel...superb staff...!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION, NICE STAFF, GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: JRITAW
Reviews.Content: Stayed and the Hampton Inn to see the baseball games and other tourist destinations. The hotel is conveniently located to Inner Harbor, free Charm City Circulator Bus and short walk from Oriole Park and Light Rail. The price was great included breakfast and the staff was nice. It was everything I hoped for when choosing a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a weekend in two different hotels, and this was our second hotel room. We had a Studio Suite which had two queen beds, a queen pull out couch, fridge, sink, spacious bathroom, free wifi. The room was VERY nice and VERY clean. The staff was EXTREMELY nice and friendly. They have 29.00 valet parking, but that was the same rate a garage around the corner charged. The only negative was the breakfast. It was something resembling an omlete, and biscuits/gravy. I have stayed in many Hampton's and this breakfast was subpar at best. It is free, so you can only take it at face value. I would definately stay here again. The location is excellent, the room was immaculate and just seemed like a relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet Rooms, Caring Service”
Reviews.Author: Travel4ever10
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in Baltimore to be near Mercy Hospital. I am from the area and know Baltimore well, so i will add this hotel is just a few blocks from the heart of Inner Harbor - and well situated for this purpose or biz as well. I contacted the hotel and explained my needs post surgery. They were WONDERFUL - very reassuring that they would have the exact type of room I wanted near an elevator, etc. Plus they were very concerned that I would be staying with them post surgery to have easy access if necessary to the hospital. The hotel was formerly a historic insurance building - so there is clever signage referring to the remodel of this hotel and others in the brand. The rooms were very very clean, very very quiet. Breakfast was good, not amazing, but standard Hampton Inn fare. The parking attendants and bell service guys bent over backwards to make sure I was OK the day of surgery. We checked in the day before. They even called up to the room to check in! They offered wonderful nearby takeaway dining ideas and a great restaurant in Little Italy that was low key - Germarno's for the night before I had ortho surgery. One of them even offered to go to the CVS and pick up a few items like Ziplocs and a few food items for our room - how much nicer is that? I have stayed in Four Seasons and would liken the training here by the those men at the front of the hotel as well done. The only unpleasant person we encountered was at the front desk - we think she is an auditor. She was rude when we asked about dining options that were nearby. My only wish is the hotel had room service as that would have been helpful post surgery..but otherwise this is an excellent find in Baltimore! It is tucked away on a quiet street - no special views from our room - but nice to find a hotel where you can actually unwind!

Reviews.Title: “Most impressive Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: This is the most impressive Hampton Inn I've ever visited. Housed in a former bank, it definitely is not the typical bland, cookie-cutter hotel typically associated with the Hampton Inn logo. We stayed in room 722, a very large room with hard wood floors, original paneling and high tray ceilings with multiple layers of detailed moldings. In addition to a king-sized bed, the room was furnished with a sofa sleeper, two ottomans, two arm chairs, a desk and miscellaneous tables, all upholstered in a sophisticated brown and turquoise scheme. There was a wet bar in the entry, with a large under-counter fridge. The bathroom had a large whirlpool tub and a granite counter top. In short, the room looked like it belonged in a luxury hotel. The reality is that appearances are deceiving; the amenities and service level were just as basic as at other Hampton Inns. The bathroom had limited, basic toiletries and the water from the shower ran around the top edge of the tub and flooded the floor. There was an individual coffee maker on the wet bar but only enough coffee to make one cup each of regular and decaf. The "glasses" at the wet bar and in the bathroom were plastic, wrapped in more plastic -- so annoying and environmentally unfriendly! This hotel would be a great place to stay with a group. Our room was big enough to host a number of people for drinks, etc. before heading out to visit the Inner Harbor or to take in a ball game. You could easily make a stay here feel like a stay in a luxury hotel if you bring your own luxury amenities to make the room that looks like a luxury hotel room feel like one!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to inner harbor, bus stops”
Reviews.Author: mac34
Reviews.Content: Hotel is rather unique being a converted bank building. Rooms are not the usual squared off box shapes of most Hamptons. Hotel is very conveniently located, 2 blks from Inner Harbor and a block from bus to Ft. McHenry or the Circulators. Only Valet parking, but it's very efficient in and out. Disappointed that there was no business center.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice and Peaceful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imransiddiqui82
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Downtown, Hampton Inn is located near to Inner Harbor which is the main center of Baltimore. In lieu of its location near to Baltimore Convention Center, Hampton Inn is best suited for all the meeting and conference activities. During my stay for 5 days, Hampton inn provided me all the comfort and amneties I was looking for. I would recomment this hotel for the peace lover and who wants extra relaxation during their long period of stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLZS
Reviews.Content: I searched the web for 2 days trying to decide where to stay, travel with my young daughter. Was hesitant with this choice due to older reviews and being it was the cheapest price0 (figure must be bad if so cheap). But after looking at map( great location) , I final decided to give a shot. Boy am I glad, the room are great, Super clean ( i am ocd ), rooms are very spacious. super friendly staff. Rooms have great flat screen tv. Another complaint on line was about paying for parking, all hotels charge for park in area 25-30 a day. I have no compliants due to I just had to drive up to front door and you can go in and out. You are two blocks from the harbor. Do not hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great staff..”
Reviews.Author: medsed
Reviews.Content: We booked this at the last minute. I called the hotel directly and a most pleasant woman helped me make a reservation. We had two queen beds and a sleeper sofa, which was perfect for the two adults and three teens we had in our group. There was a nice wet bar area. The room was spotlessly clean and a nice size. The internet worked well. The lobby was well-stocked with hot beverages....it was bitterly cold so we very much appreciated those, the fresh fruit, candy canes, and of course, the signature cookies! Everyone was friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the more than adequate breakfast buffet, to the incredibly kind valet. We needed to check out, but wanted to take in the aquarium. The valet brought the car around, allowed us to load it, then parked it where they could watch it while we were gone because it was loaded and they wanted it to be safe!! When we returned from the aquarium, a five or so minute walk each way with a two hour visit in between, the car was ready and waiting right out front.... Oh and the sweet ladies at check out were so nice, they told the kids to come in and get a hot chocolate for the road after the aquarium...how nice! I would highly recommend this well-located, well-cared for hotel and I plan to use it this spring for another stay myself!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Gone Awry!”
Reviews.Author: AMM-PA
Reviews.Content: Had it not been for the man banging on the room somewhere down the hall begging for "Sarah" to let him in the night could have been quite pleasant but after one hour of incessant banging and pleading I could no longer take it and called the front desk. I was promised someone would attend to it BUT one-half hour later the lonely man was still begging for "Sarah". Further calls to the front desk were unanswered and either "Sarah's" friend either fell asleep or found somewhere else to go some time later. The rooms were adequate in size considering it had been a converted insurance building and the furnishings were typical for a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Did not even get past the initial phone call ... won't book here”
Reviews.Author: buzyom333
Reviews.Content: I just called the hotel to ask a couple of questions: I could not find anything on their website if wi-fi was complimentary and I needed to know if wi-fi was only in the lobby/common area or in the rooms also. I have been burned before with this distinction. I called and asked the front desk if there was a charge for internet access. I was told no. (one word answer) So I asked if wi-fi was available in the rooms or if it was just in the common areas. Her response: "I just told you it was free, what more do you want"! OK then...if I am getting attitude before I even get there, this is not a place I want to stay. Yes she may have been having a bad day. But I have 20 people that I need to put someplace for 5 nights, and I need to know they will be treated well. Sorry Hampton you lost our business from the initial phone call.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest, most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lcleachNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. The breakfast is very good, and there are different selections on different days. The best things about it is the staff. Everyone is friendly and helpful, and they make sure that any issues you have are addressed. It is an easy walk to the harbor, the convention center or Camden Yards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: ladeee
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here at this hotel. The room was so large, comfortable and spacious that we didn't want to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great price and service”
Reviews.Author: Justmythoughtsonthis
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute for fourth of July weekend. Location is walking distance to all of the attractions. Great service. We arrived at 9 and asked them to hold our luggage until 3 and they checked us into our room anyway. Clean, Clean Clean. Great valet service.We were traveling with four children, and there was plenty of room. We had a suite with 2 queens and and sofabed . Beds were comfortable, would not recommend the sofabed for adults, fine for little ones. Price was great for the location. Other hotels on the same street were at least 100 more per night. Fireworks show was beautiful. The harbor area is clean with lots to do, even if it isn't a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hampton Inn and good location”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business. It was great and about what you would expect with a Hampton Inn. The price and location make this a good bet for the city. The rooms were not huge but it is an old building in a city center so you can't expect huge rooms. The rooms were remodeled with the usual Hampton bedding. The fitness center was terrible but most Hampton's have terrible fitness centers. I had no issue with the staff. In fact I left my cell phone charger and Tanesha sent it to me right away. I did have some colleagues who stayed at the Sheraton about 1/2 a mile away and it was disgusting. The rooms were old and the conference center was awful. So overall if you want a good location and a clean room stay at this Hampton. You are right near the inner harbor and not too far from the Camden Yard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: On_The_Road_Again040
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who spends 150+ nights a year in hotels, I have to say my experience at the Inner Harbor Hampton Inn was second to none. Past trips to Baltimore have taken me to the Marriott, Hilton, or Renaissance, but on the recommendation of a colleague I decided to stay at the Hampton Inn. The location was perfect, close to everywhere you could want to go in Baltimore. And to my surprise, the room, bed, staff/service, and even breakfast were better than all of the above, and at a discounted rate. To all those brand loyals out there who might not otherwise venture to the Hampton Inn, all I can say is you are missing the best Baltimore has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Money, and Slow Internet”
Reviews.Author: HorribleHamptonInn
Reviews.Content: I have to say... I travel alot and I have never had a worst experience at a hotel. I had over $20 stolen, that was hidden in a to-go box of food and when I reported it I was told don't say anything to anyone by the hotel manager. Not only when they cleaned the room did they take my money, they also put trash from the trash can back onto my bed. I'm being 100% honest and I have never written a review about about anyhting bu I felt inclined to do so this time. The "Wireless" internet was horrible I could barley watch streaming video, so I got on the Springhill Hotel internet and it was faster than the hotel than I was in. Whe nI called to the hotel lobby not only di it rinng for approx. 2 minutes they hung up on as soon as they answered my question and I had to call back and have them repeat it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location to Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mlrohr4
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great and the people were so nice. We asked for early check in and actually got it. The buildings around it are a little creepy and vacant. I kept my windows closed, but other than that, it was a really nice hotel. There is little to no parking around it, so you almost always have to Valet park at $20+. It is walking distance to the harbor and shopping. Would rebook with them!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for Peabody Conservatory audition”
Reviews.Author: LenaCamperlengo
Reviews.Content: Once you enter the lobby, you feel as if you are in an old grand hotel with soaring ceilings and a cavernous lobby. Hungry from a delayed flight, the Hampton had afternoon appetizers out (chicken wings). Staff were helpful in suggesting restaurants and getting around town. Rooms were nice. We had a larger room with a sofa and a small counter/kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: zagajeski17
Reviews.Content: The hotels location was great. We were only about a 15 minute walk from both Camden Yards and M&T Bank Stadium. The inner harbor was just a couple of blocks away. The continental breakfast was nice. The valet parking was about $25 it took about 30 mins for them to bring the car around. The staff was friendly and nice. The rooms were a decent size and were clean. If you are looking for a view of the inner harbor make sure you request that type of room. We had the standard double bed room and we were looking at a vacant warehouse. The biggest plus was its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great service”
Reviews.Author: PortFamilyTravels
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this Hampton Inn. Fabulous location, excellent customer service, comfortable room. My kids always appreciate the warm cookies in the afternoon, and their breakfast is just right. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little things add up to a bad night!”
Reviews.Author: a1scuba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Baltimore Inner Harbor on a Hilton reward certificate. Arrival is on a one way street you pull up and there is a Valet there to greet you – thanks to Trip Advisor I knew this in advance and was prepared for it. The street was not too busy so it was not bad collecting your luggage and getting inside. All before your car disappears. It is $28/night for parking if you find a garage on your own it looks like $21 – Valets were patient and answered many questions. Check in with a reward voucher was OK. When we asked about the manager’s cocktail hour we were told they decided not to have one because the hotel didn’t have enough guests – this was one reason we booked this hotel. Brian at the front desk offered us 2 drinks and 2 snacks from the store area. I wasn’t sure that was because we were gold members are whether it was due to no Managers cocktail hour being cancelled. The room #635’s only view was of an ugly building across the alley and if you looked really hard right you could see some blue sky – there are no Harbor views from anywhere in the hotel. The room at first glance appeared clean until you look behind night stands and see lots of dust bunnies. There is a coffee maker and a refrigerator. The next morning we find out there was no coffee left by housekeeping. Bathroom is huge, nice tile… The big issue I had was with the bed it was one of the worst beds I’ve slept on since a trip to Mexico when we slept on a mattress foundation for a week. The bed did not seem like the typical bedding that I expect and love from the Hilton chain. It was so bad I got up in the middle of the night to take a sleeping pill, hours later I was awake stretching kinks out of my back. My girlfriend had the same experience. Ha, then I go to log on to the complimentary free internet service and find they did not give me an access code. So I had to call downstairs to get one. The health club is a joke three tired pieces of cardio equipment next to a claustrophobic looking pool area. I went down the next morning and asked to speak to a manager (tall redish-blond hair guy). I told the manager about the issues I had – he immediately reversed the charges and said it would take about a week to get the reward points reimbursed. OK so we had a bad night you expect them when you travel… I think the manager is great for acting immediately to rectify the situation. The one thing that makes this hotel so appealing is the proximity to the harbor waterfront (2 blocks) and pretty close to Camden Yards ball field… all things given, even though the manager did the right thing, I don’t think I would stay at this property again. There is a Hilton down the block I would give it a try. Also there are lots of homeless folks hitting you up around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning to Active Guests: Poor Status of the "Gym"”
Reviews.Author: COtraveller
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers have accurately described this hotel - good location, decent quality rooms, friendly staff, and standard Hampton amenitiies. I wanted to chime in on the poor quality of the workout facility. The fitness center is comprised of three cardio machines floating in a very small rom in the basement - one tradmill, one stationary bike and an elliptical. Upon check-in and inquiry about the fitness center, I was informed that the treadmill was non-operational and they were offering access to the Residence Inn facilities around the corner. I went down to the gym anyway and tried both the bike and elliptical -- both were of such poor quality, I was concerned about an injury and quickly ceased my workout. The eliptical was shaky and uneven and the bike also did not have a smooth pedal stroke. The other guest who was in the gym agreed about the poor state of the equipment and also left. It seems as if the hotel made a poor investment decision in equipment brand, as all three machines look very new. Ideally, the hotel would replace the equipment, tune up the equipment on a more regular basis, or add a set of barbells / other options. This area is the hotel's weakest aspect by far.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: yukster1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over 4th of July weekend. The location is very convenient as it's two blocks from the Inner Harbor. Our room came with a refrigerator, a decent sized bathroom and a view of an alley. There is a free continental breakfast each morning for about 2 hours which gets very crowded, and includes all of the basics (fruit, pancakes, sausage, muffins, coffee). Complimentary newspapers are also available in the lobby. There were a lot of kids at the hotel while we stayed there. They have an average sized pool downstairs, which every time that I checked was usually filled with kids. There is also a business center with internet access (via 2 computers) although the connection is not very fast. The hotel also has a small fitness center, which consists primarily of cardio machines, so if you intend on lifting there, think again. Overall, if you're looking for amenities, I would not recommend staying here but if you're on a budget and want to be close to everything, then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: BrckNJ
Reviews.Content: This was an upscale Hampton Inn. We had a 2 bedroom (queen beds) and sofa bed in our room. The room also had a microwave, refrigerator, sink and coffee pot. We were very pleased with the location, hotel, and staff. The hotel is 2 blocks from the inner harbor and about 7 blocks from camden yards. Everyone there made our stay a terrific one. The hotel has valet parking and when your leaving you just have to call down about 10 mins before and by the time you check out your car is waiting out front. The hotel also had a continental breakfast in the morning, small breakfast but it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: batt74
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a good location just a block or two from many of sites. the rooms are very spacious and clean. the property is nothing special but it's perfect for families or groups.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: redelaneymd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn during our recent trip to Baltimore. This Hampton lived up to Hampton Inn expectations. The room was clean and well appointed. We had a 2 queen bed suite. The sofa bed was located in the same room as the two beds - there was not a separate room, which we would prefer. However, space comes at a premium in any city. Having the extra sleep space is a must when you have 3 kids. The breakfast included the usual continental items as well as scrambled eggs, ham, and buscuits. Overall, the breafast was good, not great, but good. I don't complain when I save having to feed a family of 5 in the morning! We did make use of the pool, which was clean, but small. The kids, of course, thought it was wonderful. The excercise facility included a treadmill, an elliptical machine, and one recumbent bike. There is free wirless internet, which is a bonus. The best part of this hotel was its location. It is only 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor - shopping, dining, the National Aquarium, Maritime Museum, etc. We walked everywhere we wanted in the Harbor area. As for the valet parking, We opted to just park ourselves in the parking garage around the corner - it was $21 dollars per day, which saved $7 plus tip, and I knew exactly where my car was located. The garage was conveniently located right on our walk to the Harbor area. Overall, I would recommend the hotel for a visit to Baltimore as a tourist.
