If you want luxury - then go luxurious and spend $500 or more a night. If you are happy with the Hampton Inn, which I am, then you will find this hotel up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bassmeister
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel all around. They have a nice breakfast spread, and even a manager's reception each weeknight that you can get your "snack-appitite" satisfied in the evening! For the most part, the staff were extremely friendly and willing to do what it takes to make you happy. The rooms are nice and were clean upon check-in. One word of advice, though - do not hang the "do not disturb" sign on the door if you would like your room freshened up the next day. I hung the sign up for two of my four nights stay - and got no maid service (and I had it down each day before the posted check-out time). It seems that if housekeeping sees the do not disturb sign, they just check you off on their list and move down the hall without returning. It was easily made up, though, by the satisfaction I had with the rest of the hotel experience. I would reccomend taking a taxi if you are staying a long time - you can walk to many food and shopping areas (if you do not mind getting hit up by homeless people every block). They do stick it to you with no public parking on site - and charging $28 a day for valet - OUCH! Don't let that stop you from staying here, though. This is a nice facility that you are sure to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: velasco1983
Reviews.Content: The parking was a bit pricey, but the hotel room and cleanliness of hotel was amazing. I would recommend you stay on the 7th floor in the historic rooms. Dont worry, they arent old inside, but the foyer / hallway is amazingly beautiful. The breakfast was great, the location was superb, and the hotel staff was awesome. Our jacuzzi didnt work, so they comp'd our room (awesome) and took off the parking charges! WOW! The city is awesome, plenty of walking to do. I would recommend eating at Phillips Crab House. The inner harbor is incredibly romantic, so keep your honey warm on the cold, November nights. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mamakiwi
Reviews.Content: Okay, I almost cancelled this reservation when I drove into town and saw all the horrible traffic and construction. There is no drive to pull into - the hotel opens directly onto a crowded one way street. I thought I would NEVER get the car valet parked much less unload the luggage. However, I had a wonderfully pleasant surprise. When I pulled up to the hotel, the valet was instantly at my side - helped unload the bags and took the car in an efficient and friendly manner. He returned it the same way the following morning. The hotel is about 2-3 blocks off the inner harbor. Had I the budget, I would have stayed at the Renaissance Hotel which is DIRECTLY on the harbor and has a nice covered walkway into a food and shopping area. However, my budget was not for $350/night and this hotel was about $239. It was a reasonable walk to the aquarium. The science center would be too far. Lots of restaurants around the area. The room was extremely large and VERY comfortable. The breakfast the next day was okay - the scrambled eggs were hard - how does that happen? But otherwise it was very nice. And Mon-thurs they have a manager's reception from 5-6pm with free wine and beer and munchies. Nice touch. But the ULTIMATE moment was when the hostess walked around the lobby after the reception was over with a plate of HOT chocolate chocolate chip cookies. YUM YUM YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN/ARRIVAL: I stayed at the Baltimore Hampton Inn & Suites on Sunday August 19, 2007 with my wife and almost 3-year-old son. We stayed on a Hilton award night, so I can’t comment on value for the money. When we arrived, the valet parking was a little confusing; there was a little sign on a pole that explained the charges (Note, it is $28, not $25 as their web site indicates), but there was nobody around, and it didn’t seem obvious that you just stopped there. I parked at the curb and went inside where I found the valet guy. Check-in was simple and fast, we did so at about 4:45 pm. LOCATION: The location is good because it is only a short 2 block walk to inner harbor attractions. The area seemed ok during the day when there were people walking around to work etc, but I would be a little weary of walking around at night. Because we have the little one, we were back at the hotel by 8:00 so we didn’t need to walk around at night. ROOM: We were in room 627. The room was large but seemed to have a bad layout. There is a big space in from on the closet, but then the chair/ottoman is right next to the left side of the bed by the windows. It is a little tight getting in and out of the bed in the middle of the night in the dark. There is a desk with a standard office chair, a sitting chair with ottoman, king size bed, small “coffee” table, bench, and dresser/entertainment unit. The room has a TV small microwave, mini refrigerator, and coffee maker. There is no safe in the room. There is complimentary wired (cable provided) and wireless Internet access. The TV has pay per view and HBO, but only about 20 regular channels. The view from the window was an abandoned building (see photos). The room was quiet, not much street noise, but there were a couple of sirens during the night. BATHROOM: The bathroom was a decent size. Toiletries were “Purity Basics” brand, which I believe is a Hampton Inn brand. There was shampoo, conditioner, body wash, moisturizer, shower cap, shoe mitt, cotton balls/q-tips/nail file. There was a hairdryer as well. Water pressure in the shower was good, water stayed hot and the shower head was at a good height. RECREATION: There is a fitness room and pool on the lower level. I didn't use the fitness room but it looked small and seemed to have an elliptical, bike, and treadmill. There was also a TV in the fitness room. The pool was an ok size for an indoor hotel pool. There was a very strong smell of chlorine when you entered the room. I was a little itchy after exiting. The towels at the pool are a joke, they were very small, not even 3 ft by 2 ft and very thin. MISC The breakfast was pretty much the standard free continental breakfast. There was also a hot item, but I couldn’t tell what it was by looking at it. I think it was some sort of sausage inside an egg. All of the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. We forgot our toothbrushes and got 2 from the front desk. CHECKOUT: We had 9:00 am tickets for the aquarium so we checked out using video checkout around 8:30 to head over to inner harbor. We left our bags with the Valet. We came back around 2:00 pm to get our bags and car. Again, staff was friendly and asked us if we needed directions etc, while another valet got our car.

Reviews.Title: “No Views...But Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: MrFoxBox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Baltimore Inner Harbour for one night while attending-working a few Orioles games in early June. I arrived after midnight, checked in with no problems with a very courteous staff member, and received the king room I had requested. Also, during check in, since I was a member of the Hilton Honors program I was told to grab a few waters out of the cooler, and 2 snacks from the wide selection they had onsite. The room was very well equipped, nicely decorated and very clean. There was ample workspace, and free internet service. The TV channel selection was very good as well as the reception. The bed was very very comfortable, soft sheets and great pillows, I could have stayed in bed all day but I had some sightseeing to do. The bathroom was very big….lots of room to move around, great soaps and stuff provided, large shower, rounder shower curtain rod for extra room, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I had the complimentary breakfast buffet located on the lobby level, it had a wide selection of cereal, fruit, breads, hot cinnamon rolls, biscuits and gravy (on that day), coffee, juices and assorted beverages…it was a bit hard to navigate as things seemed kind of out of order and place…but items were replenished well, and there was plenty of room to eat, and lots of tables, along with a wide screen TV to catch up on the news… This hotel is located about town and a half blocks from the Inner Harbour area, and was very safe to walk around during the day time, and when I arrived late at night via taxi, there did not seem to be any bad activity in the area. Lots of places to eat and see in the Inner Harbour area. I took advantage of the luggage storage service from the bellmen desk, and they secured my items in a locked room ( free of charge + tip ) while I saw the sights that day. Keep in mind that there are basically no views from this hotel, your window either looks down to an alley or a street out side, I was on the alley side of things and there was virtually no noise issues whatsoever….but the rooms and service are great ! I would have stayed here the other nights but was staying on an award night, and wanted to be closer to the ballpark, 6 or 7 blocks away….enjoy this property…I did !

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: freebies2me
Reviews.Content: Family trip to the Inner Harbor. The hotel was clean and the staff was amazingly courteous. On our first morning my 5 year old son commented that there were no waffles for breakfast. The lady in charge of breakfast service (Jeanette) overheard him and told him she would have waffles the next day. The next morning, the waffles were there, my son was thrilled. The entire staff from the front desk to the parking attendants were friendly and helpful. Overall a clean and family friendly hotel. The hotel is a convenient 2-3 block walk from the Inner Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: profshanku
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites for 5 days. We were in town to attend a conference at the convention center which is 2-3 blocks away. Inner Harbor is only 2 blocks away. Area seemed reasonably safe. Breakfast was good, typical Hampton Inn type. We got upgraded to the historic 7'th floor. Rooms are spacious and the bathroom was pretty big. Parking at the hotel is by valet only. The cost is $25 a night plus tax which comes out to be $28 but you can drive in and out unlimited number of times. The lady at the reception, however, told us not to leave anything in the car - she said that the reception would keep the luggage after check-out and we could load the car only when we were leaving. They allow you to check out by 12:00 but you can pick up the car anytime before 5:00 pm Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: WaterfallsLover
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Baltimore Inner Harbor Hampton Inn primarlily to be close to the Preakness racetrack. It was the least expensive hotel in the area during the hustling and bustling of the Preakness and it's close to the Inner Harbor area. Boy were we surprised to find super comfortable beds, a very large bathroom, and all of the amentities us girls needed to have an enjoyable and convenient trip. The breakfasts were great, all of the staff members are friendly and it was only 2 1/2 blocks from the Inner Harbor area. I've stayed in many hotels. In my opinion, the Hampton Inn surpassed what many 5-star hotels claim to offer. We can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing upscale hotel! Gorgeous inside!”
Reviews.Author: ritzlover
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise! You feel like you are in a boutique New York hotel when you enter your room at this very hip, very well done hotel! Our room, #722, was a corner room with hardwood floors, 14+ foot ceilings, gorgeous mouldings, etc. Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly and gracious. The hotel was immaculate. Beautiful pool on the lower level. GREAT place to stay close to the aquarium, restaurants, etc. WILL return for sure! A++

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: jamieleigh1
Reviews.Content: Girls weekend in Baltimore. Got a great AAA rate and the place was just immaculate. Huge, too. Nice breakfast, nice people, beautiful property. No reason to stay anywhere else. Only complaint - the sofa bed was not comfortable - recommend paying the extra few bucks for a cot!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: nvagirl1
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay with this hotel after reading the great reviews and after having a enjoyable stay at a Hampton Inn in Buffalo, NY back in January. This HI in Baltimore did not disappoint. Ever person on the staff that we encountered during our short stay was warm and friendly. The valets were especially helpful and courteous despite being very busy. The hotel looks like it was recently updated with a very nice modern style. We had a king room which had wonderful modern furniture and a huge bathroom. Our room even had a mini refridgerator and small microwave. The bed also had very nice bedding. The only advice would be to pack conditioner as they only provide shampoo, lotion and soap. The location is great, only a short walk from the Inner Harbor and a $5 cab ride to the great restaurants in the Mt. Vernon neighborhood on N. Charles Street. We ate at Ixia which was nothing short of faboulous. If you don't go for dinner, definately go for the martinis and kick back in the hip lounge area adjacent to the bar. We live in Northern Virginia and like to take trips to Baltimore often to "get away" and the HI will definately be our regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, warm, helpful staff - great building”
Reviews.Author: JerryReilly
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for the three day Mid Atlantic Nursery Trade show in Mid January 2007. This hotel was not on the list of hotels for the event but I chose it because of the usual friendly Hampton Inn staffs and wonderful included hot breakfast. This location exceeded my fondest expectations.They had a most welcome complimentary hot snack, beverges 5-7 gathering attended by the Hotel GM and Sales Manager who cannot do enough for their guests! The business center with 2 PC's was welcome as I have no laptop. Kudos to the management of this exemplary Hampton Inn! Jerry Reilly Outdoor Visions Hellertown PA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Heavenly Bed!”
Reviews.Author: pscho57
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at the Hampton Inn Baltimore Inner Harbour. It was a great find - perfect location, friendly service, nice amenities and the most comfortable bed I've slept on in a hotel in ages! We pulled up to the entrance and were immediately welcomed by the valet, who explained how the parking service would work during our stay. Check-in was fast and efficient. There is some construction going on across the way (new Springhill Suites). Our room was small, but with plenty of room for three adults to lounge and be comfortable. I was happy to find two queen size beds (not doubles). And speaking of the beds - they were heavenly! The down comforter and pillows were so comfy and the mattress could not have been more perfect. Just an all-around pleasant experience. Our view was of an abandoned bank building - I suppose if it was occupied it would have been just slightly disconcerting to be so close to another building. However our only neighbors were the pigeons roosting on the windows! We didn't spend much time in the room, so I was okay with the view (or lack of it). The room came with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker - all very welcome. The bathroom was renovated nicely and the shower had an adjustable shower head for massage, etc. The towels were fluffy, clean and plentiful (I mention this because I HATE thin hotel towels!). The staff was friendly and efficient - including the housekeepers, front desk, valets and breakfast attendant. I love the Hampton chain for the hot breakfast (eggs, biscuits, ham, cereal, bagels, english muffins, fresh fruit, muffins, juices and more (sausage and french toast on the second morning instead of the eggs and ham)) which saves me a good amount of money. Coffee and tea are available all day. There is also a managers reception each Monday - Thursday night from 5-6 - the one we made offered wine, beer, soda, swedish meatballs, mac and cheese, broccoli. Location is quite convenient - two blocks to the Inner Harbour, McDonald's for the kids and a CVS for snacks and emergencies on the next corner, plenty of shopping and restaurants and an easy 10 minute walk to Camden Yards. Really, I couldn't have asked for more from a fairly inexpensive hotel right in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Hampton Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Hampton Inn Baltimore Inner Harbor. We have 3 small children and finding spacious hotel rooms is sometimes daunting. Hampton Inn Studio Suite offered 2 double beds with a pull out couch, microwave, fridge, coffee maker and PLENTY of space for a reasonable price. Breakfast was plentiful and having complimentary coffee all day is a plus. Hotel is within walking distance to everything in the Inner Harbor. We did not have to use our car the entire weekend. Parking is $25 per day, but that seems to be the average among the other hotels as well. There is a small indoor pool which the kids enjoyed, however, because of the size of the room it gets quite loud in there if there are more than a few people in the pool. I found housekeeping to be efficient and friendly. Some of the Front Desk staff could use some brushing up on customer service. They were sometimes unfriendly and short with their responses. I usually like to stay at a full-service hotel, but our stay at Hampton was nice and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Good Breakfast, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: amazingrace214
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here for the holiday weekend- I had to modify my reservation by cancelling a day out of my 2 night stay-Hotel staff understood and charged me the same rate for 1 night, without any penalties even though it was less than 24 hours before my reservation date. This hotel is only 2 blocks from the the Inner Harbor Restaurants, malls etc. We left the car in valet and walked everywhere else in the area. Although we got there early, (11:30am) and check in is not until 3pm,we were able to store our luggage and take the convenient walk around the Inner harbor (went to the National Aquarium, had tapas and Sangria at Pesca, played some hoops and bowled at ESPN zone, and relaxed on our own paddle boat.) The Gallery is also a great simple mall to go to getting out of the sun only about a block around the corner. Only complaints: Parking ($25 a day). And the view is of an Abandoned building-but we just kept the curtain closed- Other than that, you'll see the other hotels nearby which look just as nice, but as far as value for Hampton Inn, nothing beats the free hot/cold breakfast-Unlimited Tea & Coffee and awesome down comforter. I'd probably stay here again. Oh, and watch your kids during breakfast---the attendant doesn't seem to tolerate them being in the way, especially when there's a hot plate in her hands.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hampton Inn we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: sunmaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites Inner Harbor for one night this past weekend. We were traveling with our three- and five-year-old sons, and our seven-year-old nephew. We arrived in Baltimore at around 12:30 PM, and the hotel check-in time wasn’t until 3. I had requested an early check-in, but was well aware of the fact that it would most likely be denied due to it being an extremely busy weekend in Baltimore. Even though we weren’t able to check in, the valet did park our car and store our luggage for us. We just walked the two short blocks to the harbor and did our tour of the Harborplace and aquarium while we waited to be able to check in. When we came back to the hotel, our check-in was handled promptly and the staff referred to me by name, which is always nice. We did have to wait about ten minutes for a valet staff member to turn our luggage over to us, but again, it was understandable because they were very busy. Our room was assigned to us per our HiltonHonors preferences, and was in turn very comfortable. We always stay at Hampton Inns, and this is the first time we’ve visited one that actually had the down-like comforters. It was just like home! The pillows and beds were also perfect! The room was actually bigger than most of the other rooms we’ve ever had, and it included a huge ottoman in front of the sofa. Did the boys ever love that! My only complaint is that the TV had a very limited number of channels, and since we were with our young children, that made it somewhat difficult. They wanted to watch Playhouse Disney on Sunday morning, but the hotel didn’t offer the Disney Channel. We tried to have them watch Cartoon Network, but when we put the TV on that channel, all we got was one screen that never changed, but there were the voices for whatever the show was supposed to be. Luckily I was able to take over by saying I needed to watch the Weather Channel so we could plan the rest of our trip accordingly! We didn’t visit the pool, nor did we order from the room service menu. Our package included a bottle of champagne and a package of chocolates. Both were great, and the deal we got by booking that package was excellent. Somehow we managed to save $60 by going with the package deal instead of the hotel’s “Best Available Rate.” I definitely recommend checking into all of the available rates when you’re looking to stay at this Hampton Inn. Another great feature that we’ve not experienced at any other Hampton Inns was the convenience story in the lobby. We were able to purchase sodas and snacks and charge them to the room as we needed them. This was very useful to us, as it started to rain on the evening of our stay and continued to do so until and after we checked out. The free “on the house hot breakfast” was great; we all found something appealing to have for breakfast, and that can be difficult when you have young children! Everything was being restocked constantly, and the staff members that were doing this were very friendly. Overall, I would say this was the best experience we’ve had at a Hampton Inn, and I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the Inner Harbor area. Should we ever return to Inner Harbor in the future, we will most definitely stay there again.
